Legal_Issue: Whether the Applicant met the residency requirements under subsection 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed 1,204 days of physical presence in Canada but had significant absences, including 1,092 days in India; lack of corroborating evidence for addresses and family presence in Canada
Court_Ruling: Citizenship Judge's decision upheld under reasonableness standard
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to provide sufficient evidence of residency in Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged compliance with residency requirement through physical presence and qualitative factors
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, qualitative residency factors from Koo v. Canada
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review without new evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Doubt cast on applicant's claimed residency due to lack of supporting evidence
Evidence_Used: Self-reported days of presence, absence records, address claims, family location claims
Application_Basis: Accumulation of three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application
Evidence_Assessed: Applicantâ€™s presence records and supporting documentation for residency claims
Relief_Sought: Judicial review of citizenship refusal and reinstatement of application
Governing_Rule: Residency must be established by physical presence or qualitative connection to Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of corroborating evidence for residency claims
Outcome: Appeal dismissed; applicant may reapply after re-establishing residency
Harm_Assessment: No harm established due to lawful denial based on non-compliance
Cause_Description: Applicant contested denial of citizenship due to alleged failure to meet residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: No new evidence accepted on judicial review
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient and uncorroborated evidence of Canadian residency
Evidence_Assessment: Negative due to lack of verification and corroboration
Decision_Rationale: Citizenship Judge reasonably concluded non-compliance with residency requirement based on insufficient evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation to support residency claims
